programmes.show_description: ...Most Hated Family in Crisis. Following up on his 2007 documentary, The Most Hated Family in America, Louis Theroux returns to Topeka, Kansas, for a week-long visit with the Westboro Baptist Church.

programmes.show_name: Louis Theroux's LA Stories: Among The Sex Offenders
programmes.show_description: In his final LA Story, Louis Theroux spends time in the twilight world of the city's paroled sex offenders, who live under force of tough regulations.
Dermot O'Leary, Penny Lancaster, Krishnan Guru-Murthy, Judi Love, Michael Vaughan, Craig Revel Horwood and Nikki Fox are on hand to assist the contestants hoping to win big.
Shopping from Home.
Hide and Seek: Rachel takes up her duties as an Inspector by organising a joint raid with CID on a crack den, where a frightened young girl is found boarded up in the fireplace.
First Strike: Rachel is frustrated when two brothers offer different versions of the stabbing of a drug dealer. Will gets a chance to impress Neil, who makes him an interesting offer.
Hold Me Tight: Part 1: A hysterical mother reports her eight-year-old daughter missing, but when a body is discovered the only two suspects are released for lack of evidence.
Hold Me Tight: Part 2: Evidence reveals Mason Kemble was present at his classmate's murder and Neil arrests him. Grace becomes frustrated as she struggles to get the truth out of the boy.
The Rookie: Will joins the CID team as a trainee, and tackles the case of a developer who goes missing after threats from anti-capitalist protesters and a protection racketeer.
Ben Shephard hosts the quiz show in which four players take on an extraordinary machine in the hope of winning its 10,000 pound jackpot.
Ben Shephard hosts the quiz show in which four players take on an extraordinary machine.
Ben Shephard hosts the quiz show in which four players take on an extraordinary machine.
Ben Shephard hosts the quiz show in which four players take on an extraordinary machine.
A Lamborghini supercar crashes and bursts into flames, leaving two passengers with serious injuries. Also, a patient requiring urgent care leaves the team with an outsized problem.
A car being pursued by police crashes and HART are called to treat a passenger trapped in her seat with serious injuries. Meanwhile, floodwaters swamp a Yorkshire town.
A horse rider is hit by a car on a country road, leaving both her and her horse with serious injuries. Plus, the centre of Leeds is locked down after a suspicious package is found.
The HART paramedics race to rescue the passenger of a car involved in a high speed crash, and the medics face crossing a fast-flowing river to help a man who's gone missing from home.
Caroline treats an unvaccinated Covid patient who's been in a coma for weeks. Matron Hazera assesses a deep tissue injury and Kat cares for a man in pain after kidney stone surgery.
Matron Hazera is called to save a person standing on the edge of a building, while nurse Kat treats a woman with suspected ovarian cancer.
The second series of the hilarious comedy sketch show begins. Characters this time include Lauren, Derek Faye, who may find someone impertinent, and Nan.
Catherine Tate's back with another batch of brilliantly observed characters, including an unorthodox dog trainer whose methods produce quite frankly hair-raising results.
Award-winning comedy sketch series with characters played by the versatile actress. Tactful wigmakers to the stars Ivan and Trudy are introduced. Una Stubbs guest stars.
It's Australia Day and the paramedics are swamped with alcohol-related calls, including one about a man found passed out in his car in the middle of the road.
Documentary following Louis Theroux as he travels to San Francisco where a group of pioneering medical professionals are helping children with gender dysphoria. Ep22
...States: Love Without Limits. Louis travels to Portland, Oregon, and discovers a whole spectrum of non-traditional family set-ups: some that work and some that have been pushed to breaking point.
The players face a colossal spinning wheel as they attempt to win a fortune with some help from Peter Andre, Rob Beckett and Patricia Bright.
Shopping from Home.
You Don't Know Jack: The top-rated domestic sitcom with former Citizen Smith and Extras guest star, Robert Lindsay. Michael has a new friend in school and Susan has a new admirer.
What's up, Docklands?: Putting the beef into the domestic sitcom. Ben and Susan decide to help out some friends by flat sitting their brand-new Docklands apartment.
Luck Be a Lady Tonight: Popular domestic sitcom. Susan suggests Roger should make Abi jealous, and Ben despairs.
First Past the Post: Family fun with the eccentric Harper family, starring Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker. With a burst of civic pride, Susan decides to run for the council.
My Will Be Done: Zoe Wanamaker is one half of a quirky couple in the popular sitcom. Ben thinks about his will and Nick takes a job at a funeral director's.
My Fair Charlady: Here's something most Mums dream about in the popular sitcom. Susan employs a cleaner, who turns out to be such a treasure that she takes over the cooking as well.
Ben Shephard hosts the quiz show in which four players take on an extraordinary machine.
Ben Shephard hosts the quiz show in which four players take on an extraordinary machine.
Ben Shephard hosts the quiz show in which four players take on an extraordinary machine.
Sunny, Bertie & Edith: Bouncy Golden Retriever puppy Bertie has a dislocated hip, Tibetan terrier Sunny is almost immobile, and Springer Spaniel Edith has a bulging spinal disc.
Domino, Diamond, Willow & Luigi: Pop superstar Will Young brings in two of his rescue dogs, Domino and Diamond, while supermodel Yasmin Le Bon's French Bulldog Willow collapses at home.
Monty, Odin & Maya: Caucasian Shepherd Odin has Wobbler Syndrome, Toy Poodle Monty needs a total hip replacement, and Malamute Husky Cross Maya needs to get back on her four feet again.
Poppy, Keira & Bella: In this puppy special, Noel treats Border Terrier Kiera, and we look back at Springer Spaniel Poppy, who had one of the worst leg deformities Noel had ever seen.
Pretzel, Bran & Wobble: In this rescue special, we meet abandoned kitten Pretzel with severely twisted back legs, and look back at Wobble the Whippet and three-legged German Shepherd Bran.
The West Midlands crews treat a pensioner whose heart rate is so erratic they are worried he might have a heart attack on the way to the hospital.
Crews from West Midlands Ambulance Service attend a diabetic who has collapsed at home, reassure the wife of a man with heart problems and keep up the spirits of a woman with womb cancer.
A girl has an operation to have squints in both eyes realigned, a man has his infected gall bladder removed and an ex-police officer is having a grommet inserted in her ear.
A woman has an operation to repair the hernia she suffered while giving birth and a four-year-old's ear blockage is so bad he needs a general anaesthetic to it sucked out.
Every Student Counts: Student midwives Ruby and Grace are in the second year of their studies and are now learning on the job. Summah and her friend Lilli enjoy cocktails and a takeaway.

programmes.show_name: Stacey Dooley: Face to Face with Armageddon
programmes.show_description: The journalist meets Americans prepping for an uncertain future, all with different concerns - from climate change and natural disasters to civil unrest.
Louis Theroux explores relationships complicated by medical conditions. Here, he visits one of America's best schools for autism.
